description: Students examine a major period of German history and its impact on the institutional, intellectual,
and artistic heritage of Europe. This course involves close reading and analysis of primary sources
as well as critical evaluations of the period and focus on history as an interpretive reconstruction
of the past.  Sample periods include: the Reformation, Weimar Classicism, the German revolution
of 1848, post-1945 Germany, and post-unification. The course emphasizes strategies for writing
papers in German.  Taught in German. May be counted toward German major or German
studies concentration. Prerequisite: German 251 or German 252.  May be repeated if topic is
